item.title: Introduction to JavaScript
item.description: This JavaScript tutorial is intended for both experienced users and users that are just starting out on their programming journey. JavaScript is not considered a compiled language. JavaScript is considered an interpreted language, meaning that the browser converts JavaScript code on the fly into a machine language that the computer can understand. JavaScript is an object-based scripting language. JavaScript can be used on a variety of operating systems such as Windows, Linux, and Mac.
